conversations.body_text: Hi Nick_reid,    Are you currently using F1 track mode or rally mode? Pedal travel is the most important factor in different modes.      F1 Mode: Suitable for short-travel braking. Using one damper provides the shortest travel. The 10mm spacer inside the brake spring can also be used to shorten travel, simulating brake disc clearance. One damper combined with the 10mm spring spacer is ideal for F1, giving the shortest braking travel.  Rally Mode: Suitable for long-travel braking, with up to three dampers. You can remove the 10mm spacer in the brake spring to increase travel.         Different damper colors suit different braking force requirements, depending on the maximum force you need. You can refer to the manual or product details for guidance on adjustments.
